intro: Ferula sauvagei, commonly known as the wild fennel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant is characterized by its tall, branched stems and feathery, aromatic leaves. Its yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Ferula sauvagei is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
